UsPuKzSm1A7NVg3kooCDQA.text: I haven't been to this place in a while-- I was contracting at Intel and this was a nice spot to hit for lunch, so I went several times over the course of 3 months, and from a convenience standpoint it certainly had a great taste-to-distance ratio.  There were basically two minuses that subtracted from my experience there.  First, maybe because they are catering to a business lunch crowd that isn't familiar with more authentic Thai seasonings or-- well, I don't really know-- their food tended to be overly sweet.  The pad thai was very sweet, such that someone I brought there for lunch was almost unable to finish it.  The yellow curry (one of my favorites) was also cooked such that the curry itself was discolored, with brown flecks-- I was told by another Thai cook that this is from over-cooking some part of the mix, but I'm afraid I can't help past there (though it did not taste burned and it didn't actually taste bad, it just tasted "off").  Second, this is the second location as far as I know and it definitely lacked some atmosphere.  It felt more like a generic restaurant with some Thai decor thrown in for good measure.  The first location is a little bit more quaint, and the people working there seemed slightly more relaxed-- since that first location is not in the same sort of business-centric area, it's entirely possible that the faster pace of this second location is just part of doing business.  Anyway, for a quick Thai lunch in the Chandler area it's not a bad choice at all.  I just think if you're looking for a serious Thai meal, that this one strays a tad too much from authenticity.

UIjvgnfj5_JZj5dLV20PXA.text: One of my favorite Thai restaurants.   The Tom Yum is really very authentic and I enjoy the gai gatiam pad thai or garlic chicken.    I have not been back since I turned vegetarian, but know I can get some excellent vegi dishes.   Service and take out is great.   Strongly recommend.

W3DAwX2ItCwcSxWCzZD5Sg.text: This is a regular lunch spot for me and my co-workers.  If you go in at lunch time, you will see that it is a regular place for a lot of people.  It can get very busy, but the staff does a great job of providing top notch service even when packed.  I am not an expert on Thai food, but I have not tried anything there that wasn't outstanding.  It is really hard to come up with a favorite, just try any of the lunch specials and you can't go wrong.  One word of warning, they let you pick your level of spiciness, and I find that if you are sensitive to spicy food, you might want to be a bit conservative.

ZgdXGxcMb3nOQy9An-aOYA.text: It is ok, nothing fantastic.  Definitely not the best thai food, but it would work in a bind.  Very average.

-DtSgYuwrFD9goImmoj6ZQ.text: Good fast service. Pad See Iew was very good. Garlic delight was good. Large portions. Pretty much everything we had was good. We'll be back.

8Hfl1x6TwqwbfaU8S6hRbQ.text: My favorite Thai restaurant since my coworker introduced it to me as her favorite. My favorite is pad sew iu. The lunch menu price is great, even after they raised it once. The Thai ice tea is awesome. I also love their panang. I've taken so many of my friends there and they all loved it. The service is great too. Highly recommended.

OGLeesusIj4qQPNcs65jmQ.text: This place is great!  I've been here a few times so far and have ordered the Green curry, red curry and pad thai, all of which are great!!  The service is friendly, however once it was a little slow.  The food makes up for it though!  I usually do takeout because I have noticed that you get bigger portions that way.  The curry comes in a huge to-go container!!

S7N2TP4wHxywBMzsCmX6bg.text: I've had thai food at a few other places in the valley and this place is by far my favorite. I went with a few friends a couple weeks ago and all of our meals were great!

SRyw3ClqTerCzgx7-JOWCw.text: Ordered Pad Thai with level 4 spiciness. It is not that spicy but I think it is a bit too oily for me. Pad Thai from Thai Cafe is much better.

M-rpJnw3pIb4loGsEcXhQg.text: We were craving food from this place so badly the other night that I drove all the way from South Phoenix to Chandler to pick some up! The food was ready just a few minutes after I got there, and they must have packaged it *really* well (or made it super hot) because it was still hot when I got home 30 minutes later. We didn't try anything new (just the Pad Thai and duck curry, our favorites from last time), but it was just as delicious. The only change I made was ordering our curry "5" (on the 1 to 5 spiciness scale) - it was definitely hot but not as hot as we would get in the Bay Area when we asked for spicy. Can't wait to go back again!

uFL2KQPZ1sPe2cCGsooTGQ.text: I've never actually eaten in the restaurant - Swaddee is one of those places I used to pick up and take home when I lived in Chandler. So, first their take-out process: they've never botched an order, food has been ready within the time frame given each and every time, and I'm almost always in and out in a flash. The food: I've sampled various veggie and seafood options, and they've all been equally delicious. Since I've never been inside for more than a few minutes, I can't really vouch for the atmosphere or the service, but I stand by the food. A little pricier, perhaps, than the Thai Basil down the street, but totally worth it.

uBpt5A5-8vousnXVOIKO1Q.text: So we ordered again - take out, again, and we had the pad thai (with everything, and extra egg) and the snow peas and mushrooms. I asked for pad thai noodles with my snow peas  and mushrooms, but they would not stir fry them together - so they charged me for a side.  Aside from being a bit overpriced, the delivery was fine.  And really, really fast...order to delivered was 23 minutes!

WArbmDSEZmACtBvruYDjcg.text: tI recently relocated to Phoenix from Silicon Valley, where there are fantastic Thai restaurants pretty much everywhere.  I decided to try Swaddee based on reviews here.  This is my opinion on what I tried:  1. Tom Ka Gai Soup:  To be fair, I am comparing this dish to what is generally considered to be the BEST Tom Ka Gai in the SF Bay Area (Dusita Thai in Sunnyvale).  I'd give this dish a 4/5.  The flavor was spot on, but light on ingredients.  Also, they didn't use those little button mushrooms, and for the $ they are charging, I think it should have the correct mushrooms! 2. Green Curry:  5/5.  Superb.  Fabulous.  They could add some eggplant though. 3. Spicy Fried Rice:  4.5/5.  The flavor was good, it was cooked properly.  If they offered it with crab, it would be mind blowing. 4. Green Papaya Salad:  3/5.  I was disappointed that the sauce wasn't quite right.  I don't know what makes the dressing so tangy, but they should use more of whatever that is! 5. Spiciness:  I order my Thai food as 'Thai Spicy'.  Seriously, restaurants will question me repeatedly because they are afraid to serve it to me the way I like it.  I ordered everything except the Green Papaya Salad as a '5', which is supposed to be their Thai spicy.  Not so.  They would have had to double it to give me what I was expecting.    That said, it was quite good and I will return.  However, I'm going to try a few other places first...............

TRvMu3rO-5nhvDI2GFJMqA.text: My boyfriend has been talking about this place since I've known him and today when we were weeding in the yard something smelled like green curry (I know this sounds weird, but this is how my brain works, don't ask) and that was it, I had the bug, I needed Thai food. The lady who greeted us was very nice, and was the same person who served us and cashed us out for that matter. Decor was fairly standard for a Thai food place, including the compulsory fish tank right in the middle of the room. My boyfriend had his absolute favorite Pad See Ew. Which he enjoyed as always. I had the Green Curry with chicken. We both opted for the 1 star spiciness, I think the server laughed at that, but c'mon, I'm Finnish and French-Canadian here lady, my palate is not made for Thai spice! It was the perfect amount of spicy for me, and that good, creamy, warm green curry flavor. The vegetables were perfectly cooked so they still had that crunch. Maybe it was because I wasn't paying, or maybe it's because I've been desensitized by East Coast prices but I thought that $24+tip for the amount of food that we got was perfectly reasonable. I think it's a solid place.   Sidenote: I see that most people have responded "No" for delivery, however on their website, for this location it says "Call and ask about free delivery" so I don't know if it's new, or just lesser known.

phBuQf9n3NvdKjMSYGXzaQ.text: Went here for lunch during the week -- it was very crowded.  As a result, it look a long time to get our food after we placed our order.  The food itself was pretty good.  I had the red curry with soft tofu and brown rice.  The service was very friendly and attentive despite the slowness.

UG378QW1n88iONw3XUJlzw.text: Always think of this place first when I am in the mood for Thai. Consistently good and friendly. You choose the level of spiciness (from 1 mild to 5 hot). I usually go with #3 and have sweat dripping from my forehead and I usually pick the Pad Thai. Pretty decent portion sizes and a good selection of vegetarian options as well.

H5MpXmTtZozcvhd3Cve9KQ.text: Terrible experience in Swaddee.  I found an used bandage in the food.  So yakkk!!!  The waitress came and grabbed the dish away.  I should've take a picture about it. She apologized for the incident.  But my friends and I had to leave.  I will never go to the place again.

ySqEnwtHSkVfGr3y7YrqTA.text: Not only the best Thai food anywhere, it's some of the best food you can get, anywhere, period.  The red curry with chicken is so good it should be illegal.

OMgwvzuerL-x3OJ6HzQ-gw.text: I love spicy thai food and Swaddee certainly didnt let me down. I feel like this is a great hidden gem in Chandler, I would have never known it was there unless it had been pointed out to me. I have had a few favorites like green curry and pad thai here and they are all delicious.

xjhIz54zQ4zngZiyhyetJA.text: Swaddee's is....all right. As I was answering a question in one of the talk threads, I realized, though, that it's spicy-meter is a bit inconsistent. I've had times when the pad Thai, at a 3, is more than I can handle. At other times, I've ordered a curry at "medium" only to find out it's not spicy in the least... Basically, I think this place is a solid choice for Thai, but it's by no means earth-shattering or anything like that. I actually like the lunch options better than dinner here. The first few times I've eaten at Swaddee's have  all been at lunch, and I've been impressed. But then I ordered the Panang curry to-go, for dinner. I asked for it with tofu, and I got a curry with tofu and onions. That's it. No veggies, nothing. That's really odd for a Thai restaurant. It wasn't flavorful, either. Then I went here last week for dinner, and ordered pad Thai. The noodles were a bit dry and hard, although I have to say, the service was great. All in all, I think I'll continue to come here for lunch, but when it comes to dinner, I'll probably try to seek out some new Thai restaurants.

r1ltWEyleg3aPPju7cGR0A.text: Just stopped in 2:45 with a very hungry child who was craving pad thai. The staff basically said they will be closing in 2 minutes. They refused service to us. I guess they had places to go. Didn't even offer us take out We obviously  will never go again

WUE9yt41l0y_4VXZRk8JXw.text: This place is a hit or miss. Hence why I would rate it as average.  I've been here so many times for lunch because it's so close to work and because coworkers would suggest it.  I've had all the curries and every time the spiciness is different even though I ask for a 3.  Sometimes it's not spicy at all and sometimes it's so spicy that my mouth burns.    I've had the eggplant with chicken, but the chicken isn't as moist and tender as I hoped meat would taste like. They chopped up the chicken in very small pieces and seemed overcooked.  I would stick with the different types of curries (red, green, yellow) though.  It's safer.  The curry sauce would seep into the meat and make it more tender. The curries can also be different textures.  I've had it where it's thick and creamy (the way I like it) or more watered down.  The lunch portions are pretty small, but I guess it's enough for a lunch meal.    Beware Swaddee's if you're not too comfortable with spicy.  Just order a lower number and you can add more chili if it's not spicy enough for you.  I still would recommend this place and try your luck with the food here.  You may get lucky and have a great meal.

lqN4Z_PXXUDOH6fMbLQcfw.text: This has been our favorite Thai restaurant for many years. We try others but nothing compares. Their Tom Kah soup is excellent. Their Phad Thai is the best. We always feel like it was  money well spent when we leave Swaddee. Please give it a try - I hope you will love it too!

Z37dQJlIzqLbBT01mP_kEw.text: I would recommend the Red Curry, very good. The Thai Ice Tea was good, but not the best I've had. Customer Service was excellent. I will return to give more menu items a try.

iWDUgxpnvIy1i_zsaRLaDQ.text: Pad se ew had alright flavor but a little on the dry side. Liked the flavor of the spicy fried rice but rice was a little hard and there were no cucumbers or tomatoes. Portion size was good though. Maybe if I had saw the cockroach review, I most likely wouldn't have come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Spicy fried rice and pad se ew, both with chicken.

-jdsNDqPeQ2S_wFJ-Hr52w.text: Absolutely delicious! !!!! You can tell they take great pride in their restaurant. How many times have you gone to a little "hole in the wall" place and the condiments on the table are filthy and well used? Their plastic condiment holders were sparkling  clean. Their portions were enough for 2 ppl to share. Prices are extremely reasonable. I was really surprised at the presentation of every plate. I felt like I was eating at a fancy restaurant downtown. Truly a culinary experience that delighted the taste buds. I will most definitely be back many times.

6i2wmKz5-4RnOi7WYIJsNA.text: 3.5 Stars  Swadee is pretty great for takeout.  They have a big karaoke stage in the front which I have never seen in action, but if that is your thing it should be entertaining.   I really like the big fish tank with actually lively looking goldfish. The wait staff have always been very friendly and the service quick.   They tend to make the food on the mild side so I usually go with hot.  If you are looking for good takeout thai food with friendly staff and goldfish then check this place out.

BTq7ZjggdNPlnYG8BlPBsQ.text: Been there three times, and have tried out different dishes.  First time i got pad thai, omg, that food was sooooooooooo greasy and salty, but i swore that i was not going back there again.   But my coworker wants to go there for lunch and said the curry was good, so i went back again. This time i had the green curry with beef, it was pretty decent, flavorful yet not too strong. however, the veggie inside is a little bit more chewy that i would have prefer.  Then we went back again for lunch, this time i had the noodles, ca'n't remember what it is called. it is those very thin and transparent one. It was really good. i ordered 4/5 spiciness, but still not too spicy.   So basically it might be a hit or a miss, and it is not super spicy so if you are looking for that you might be disappointed;. overall a decent lunch spot.

6cIEwxAC5usP60xtbScTKw.text: Went with the reviews to try this place out. The location is easily accessible the ambiance is nice but nothing fancy.  Drinks: Thai coffee 4* Appetizer : Chicken Satay 2.5*, personally i felt that taste was ok and chicken was not cooked tender  Entree : Drunken noodles  The quantity was really good. Its good i stick with the spice level of 3/5. If you don't eat spice stick with 2 :). I have tried drunken noodles at many thai places so the taste here felt little low, color of the dish reflected something was missing in it. I will surely rate this dish higher on some other Thai places.  Overall if you are near this place and want to try thai not a bad choice :).

DiLG6nY0ShRb8yGN6JUvSA.text: Been to this place twice.  Both time we had to wait for the food for 30 minutes.  The food tastes delicious and the portion is good too! But man, wait time is just...  Horrible!!! Not enough people working to accommodate the traffic.  Twice,  it was the same thing! We came in a group of 5 people the first time and 3 the second time. Both were on Saturday nights.  There were 3 people working in the front the first time and this time only 2.  The restaurant was packed.  Even other tables were waiting for their food as well. They did try to get your drinks as soon as possible but it took them forever to get your order and the food out.  Love the food and everything else but I won't be back because of the wait time.

TMz9ZS1C8yc3TfZ1VamJoA.text: Not very familiar with Thai food. Tried the Pad See Iwe with chicken and #4 spicy. AWESOME!

photos.caption: Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Yum. Pad See Iwe chicken #4 spicey. Awesome!

iTfXd1oATImqx6YMDs5TYg.text: This place is really good during lunch on the weekdays.But always something else on weekends. This time they are not making the appetizers. Bummer, But the food is still good.  I had to take off a star for the following reason... our server had moved the hot sauces to make room for the food. When we got up to leave we noticed chili sauce on my 2year old's cap. I asked them to wash it. She told the other girl that my boy did it. My wife got up and told them my son was across the table in a high chair. What kind of person blames a little kid?? We just took the hat and paid the bill. They did not even offer something off the bill for staining my son's hat. Sad very sad.

AwSRPfLcLA-MmMh8oCNfaw.text: Can't go wrong with the Lunch Special. Chicken Noodles and Thai fried rice are favorites.

photos.caption: Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chicken Noodles

w5caIHvhGjB8PiXeUM3g-Q.text: Excellent Thai food!  We got take out.  The Pad Thai and Curry - excellent!  If you like medium spicy...choose #2 (spicy between 1-5).  #3 spicy...was way too hot for my husband....who is always medium spicy.   FYI...they DO NOT take AMEX; and there is a 10% discount if you pay with cash!

EXLqvdyUEnEFrW601e6Tdw.text: Had cashew chicken, coconut princess, and Tom yan soup - all quite good , with good service

rmd0ggt7CXPoZwsw1srkJw.text: The food is pretty good, I usually order the pad Thai and get a pretty fair portion every time I order. The people that work there don't seem like they like being there and are pretty rude for the most part. I would recommend just getting take out so you don't have to bother with them.

spwQROxktWRNCR5dNn0oGg.text: Usually thai cuisine is easily liked by diverse people.  Visited the place with great hopes, the whole group ordered the same pad thai dish that unfortunately turned up very sweet and quite different from other thai places.

ttmIfCapCyMe-SMg6vVnLg.text: We miss the closed Scottsdale Swaddee so much that we ventured with our neighbors to the Chandler location. We were greated like old friends. They are the nicest restaurant proprietors this side of Thailand! The food is spectacularly delicious! We always have the Tom Ka soup, one with chicken and one with tofu. For 5 of us, we did have a wee bit left over to take home: We also indulged with two of the lightly battered deep fried tempura, Thai basil noodles, two sweet and two sour shrimp, and a bowl of vege in yellow curry. For five people we enjoyed a feast of the most delectible Thai food. I have been to so many Thai restaurants, but this one has the best food, and service. You must go if you are within traveliing distance! tripadvisor.com/ShowUser...

x80BzlH1Avr2Pxp_2yw_kw.text: My wife and I eat here when we go on a date without the kids.  One of my daughters is allergic to peanuts, so a Thai restaurant is not an ideal place to take her.  We've eaten at all of the Thai restaurants in the East Valley, and this place is still our favorite.  This is where we go to get our fix when we crave spicy Thai food.  Everything we've ordered has been pretty good.  We haven't had an unsatisfactory meal here yet.    There is a reason this restaurant has stood the test of time (and the economy).  Their food and service is great.

813VJVddQWn__uXfpfLSmA.text: After 2 years of listening to my bf tell me he was going to take me here I took matters into my own hands and figured out this is the place he was talking about. We came in around 2 and ordered my bfs favorite papaya salad, Tom Yum soup, sweet and sour fish and 2 Thai teas.   Meh. It wasn't bad, but I've had better. Our bill was $40, a little pricey, especially since the first two were only appetizers.

photos.caption: Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Crab Papaya Salad

yerzWhuWsQMm18O5ZXT7Sw.text: The only reason they're not getting 5 stars is the service is slow on most days. But, if you have the time, the food is excellent, best Tom Yum soup in the valley.

m1MtxsfuNzs7Rg6hL38CwQ.text: Came here for lunch on a Saturday, and it wasn't too busy, unlike their weekday lunch rushes. We ordered the pad thai, pad see ew, and green curry lunch specials. The lunch specials are a really good deal, at only $8 for a large portion, salad, and egg roll! (The salad and egg roll weren't that impressive though)  I really liked the flavor of the pad thai (and that it came with peanuts!), but was disappointed because the pad see ew was really over-sauced. The green curry was good, but nothing special. So I would recommend the pad thai. The staff was also very friendly, and there's a 10% discount if you pay in cash!

55K6I5uUgjjAW1wrLjAlbA.text: After having lived in Seattle for seven years, there are just a few things I haven't even tried here in the Phoenix area.  Sushi for example.  Or, I guess, seafood in general.  For some strange reason, Thai food has been on the list of things that I just hadn't ventured out to try here, assuming there's no way it could live up to how great the options were in Seattle.  Then, for a co-workers birthday, I went here.  Not only was I immediately impressed with the service, the waitress recommended Thai iced tea - and it was just delicious.  I got the Pad See Ew w/ beef (5 stars 'cause that's how I roll) and it was fantastical.  The lunch special (like $8) also came with a small spring roll - which I dipped in the leftover peanut salad dressing.. just wow.  So, A for ambiance, service, and perfect Thai cuisine on a very busy Friday lunch.  Brian talk Thai - Brian talk Thai VERY good.

photos.caption: Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Thai iced tea and boobies for lunch.. awesome.

W6cx9eBn9OKKnNBkH9phcg.text: Can't get any more authentic thai food then swaddee.   I've been coming here for years and they always have been consistent with their flavor and portions.  Inexpensive place to have lunch and a great place for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Whatchu know bout these
Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Really full here
Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. the owners are really great people

L9vyk_afRdT3jqqVXlaEpg.text: They have improved a LOT since I last visited in Jan 2016. Interior, music, cleanness, and most importantly food quality are all improved. I love a business that strikes to improve over time!

dKB7wl-kWyczLXQYFZEO3A.text: Last night was my first visit to Swaddee.    I really like the fish tank in the center of the dining room. It reminds me of a restaurant I loved as a child.  I found myself staring at the fish in the tank throughout my meal.   I ordered the Pad Thai at a "level 5," but I was sure to explain I wanted it EXTRA hot.  She seemed to understand I meant ACTUALLY hot, not wimpy person hot.   I also ordered a Thai Iced Tea.  It was fabulous.    My pad thai was HUGE and delicious. I did end up adding a few more spoonfuls of red chili paste, but I initially underestimated the heat level. It did build up on me!  Did I mention the portion size was HUGE?!  After eating far more than I should have eaten, I had an entire styrofoam container of food left over.  Yeah. It was that big.   The service was great.  The ladies working there were friendly.  On the way out, I noticed one of the ladies was rolling the spring rolls by hand on a table.  She had lots to make.  They were all perfect and uniform in size. It was funny because at dinner I was talking about how perfect my grandfather made lumpia. It was just like that!    I will return to Swaddee... soon!

r204Doz5HoPEbI4cVX-oGQ.text: The soup is great as well as their tropical fried rice.  My wife got the cold beef salad which was tasty but the meat was a little chewy.  Great service and the atmosphere is nice.

veUhKw970VPsDxMoOwZFYw.text: Monday 11 June 2012, my wife & I had dinner here. We had the beef salad for appetizer. We shared a chicken vegetable stir-fry dish. The spiciness of both dishes were at 4/5. The appetizer was OK. The cook didn't even bother to trim the cabbage leaves of the old wilted parts, which substracted from the experience. The pieces of beef were cut a bit too thick, and they were a bit too salty.   The chicken vegetable stir fry was delicious and tasty. We had to add a bit more dried red pepper to both dishes as we found neither spicy enough.   The best dish was the desert - golden banana, which were 2 pieces of banana and shredded coconut wrapped in rice paper and deep fried. We requested an additional scoop of coconut ice cream for an additional charge. Totally worth it.   We will be back to try other dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Golden banana, which is banana w/ coconut wrapped in rice paper &amp; extra coconut ice cream. Delicious.

XGx9-m3AYqWpF_SLr3OfeA.text: One of the best Thai places I have eaten at here in Phoenix. There are a few must tries. The Tom Kha soup is fantastic. It's a coconut and lemon grass based soup. It has chicken, mushrooms, and other spices. Delicious. I have also had the Swaddee fried rice, the spicy noodles, and the chicken garlic delight. All have been delicious.  The cool thing about this place is that you get to choose how spicy your food is. They use a 1-5 scale, 5 being the spiciest. The 2 is a moderate medium. I haven't ventured past that. Give it a try if ur looking for Thai!

iuZ6xsOuWIKlDW6pLvDGwQ.text: What are all the 5-star reviews about??  I was led here due to the great reviews to this Thai restaurant. Even upon arriving, I was utterly disappointed. My family and I were placed in a corner (when the entire restaurant was pretty much vacant) next to another family with a baby in a highchair. This created kind of an uncomfortable space for us to even enjoy our meal. I thought the food was terrible (ie, the duck that I bit into was extremely salty, and even bit into salt during each bite. My duck was burnt as well). The service was VERY POOR- with three tables out of the many you have available in the restaurant, and the number of waiters, I'd think we would have exceptional service. I was wrong. Our waiter was in the back eating a meal. At a table. In front of all customers.  I have never wanted to leave a restaurant without consuming my food. This was the first time. Doggy bag? NO THANK YOU. If I could give zero stars, I would. For restaurant-goers looking for actual good and decent food, do not go here.

7BRLalmVH_MOlu5qT0_YYg.text: We love this place.   If you go for an early dinner it is good for kids (high chairs there).   Their food is great, service is fast and staff is nice and is really a hidden gem.    Love their green curry (more rice would be nice though) and their sampler app is the best thing to get (YUM!)

D1O5AMbMdIxeEB2PbYCGyg.text: Love the food.  Good customer service and price is amazing for the quality of food. Kind of hidden at the back of the mall.  Nice atmosphere for little place.  Don't miss it.

rtOhaTDlhQV2978_v8sWZw.text: My friend recommended the noodle soup. I went to this restaurant with my kids for dinner and we asked the waitress about it. She was very professional.She recommended it to us,so we ordered beef noodle soup, Tom yum noodle soup, and Chang mai combo (papaya salad, bbq chicken and sticky rice). The noodle soup was outstanding and real thai style. We will go back again.

Oeepcvz87KJ8RNBubvIBqQ.text: Honestly I was not a Thai food fan but one of my coworkers is so go along. Well after eating here I'm a fan! Warning spice scale is misleading. 1-5 where 1 is hot.

XmXmcgXduLCdqhwMaHXccQ.text: Overall I enjoyed the food, service and atmosphere here, but they fell short of 4 stars for me.  We were served in somewhat of a tag-team style, there were probably 3-4 different people waiting on us.  I thought that was a bit unusual.  The staff was friendly if a bit aloof.  We did have a spill at our table (yes it was me again, but no drinking was involved this time) which they could have handled better.  We had Pad Thai and an appetizer sampler-I forget what that was called.  The Pad Thai was heavily flavored and the sauce was kind of heavy.  I prefer a lighter sauce for the Pad Thai-it should not be a heavy dish like Alfredo.  The apps were good, particularly the Satay.  The Spring Rolls were overly oily.  I consider the prices here to be a bit high for Thai food as I've had so much great Thai food for very reasonable prices.  If I'm paying 12 bucks for a noodle dish it had better be excellent, not just good.

photos.caption: Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States

KSVTTSIEylM9ueUBzo6ujg.text: Food from here is very good! As someone who is in a family that doesn't like spicy things, Swaddee does a great job of making something not spicy when asked. I love their pad thai, pad se iew, thai fried rice and mee krob. Only wish there was more veggies in the pad se iew.

k79TUvhCiyR5M7hnhvNcIw.text: Came here for a lunch party.  The place was super decorated.  A little sensory overload.  We were 1 of 2 tables there.  And the service was slow.  I ordered the pad sei saw with chicken.  It was a little sweeter than I like, but it was ok.

qRovK-JdGi33lkzWvwYRuQ.text: Sure I like Thai do you like shirt?   Swaddee Thai is another strong local Thai restaurant that could use slightly lower prices for lunch time.   Every time I was in for a visit I had the red curry tofu, The sauce was rich and spicy as expected, the vegetables were a bit sparse compared to other Thai places and the tofu was not as firm as I would have liked. It came in smallish round bowl.  I did appreciate the fact that they did make my meal quite spicy when I asked for it.  This place is decent but there are better options in the neighborhood.

ieBKbtPVJu4dL1aHRoZMVw.text: Went there for lunch today. was pretty crowded and ambience is ok . Ordered Soup , Fried rice- both vegan and with chicken . really loved the kim toh soup and the fried rice was also good.   check it out if you happen to be around there .. will go back again

sIoK5zRrOua2KKdGeRFkaQ.text: I first had this Thai food in flagstaff and was in love! I figured I would try this location and it did not disappoint!   The tofu is always cooked perfectly and I've heard the chicken is great too.  I usually get either the yellow curry or the pad thai. Both of them come in epic preportions and I have lunch for the next day. The tom kha soup is delicious!  Go for the lunch special, it's cheap and the portions are still huge.   The service is fast and you won't get stuck waiting for food for too long!

SA0F1qRq-vVhtZLIYFIfTg.text: When I think of Thai food, I think of Swadee. Swadee was sort of my introductory restaurant into the world of Thai food. I've gone with many friends and family her over the years and they all have been satisfied.  So it pains me to write a bad review, but the last couple experiences I've had at Swadee have required me to bid Swadee adieu.  The first bad experience I ordered the Larb Tofu. The dish was so salty I couldn't finish it. It literally tasted like the cap fell off the soy sauce bottle and they dumped  several cups of the stuff in the pan/wok. Even if they didn't, it was pretty much inedible. Inedible in the same way a salad swimming in vinaigrette is.  The second occurred during a visit with my girlfriend. We are both vegetarians and took great care to make sure that the dishes we ordered were meat (and fish sauce, and chicken broth) free. Those ingredients can upset a vegetarian's stomach if it's been a while since they ate meat (or if they've never eaten it).   Well, my girlfriend ordered the pad thai (carefully made veg) and she found a piece of chicken in her dish. To most this would not be a big deal, but to us chicken isn't considered food and it taints the food it was cooked with. As a result she lost her appetite and it made me feel uneasy about what might be in my own meal. Our lovely Valentine's Day dinner came to a screeching halt.  And as a side note they have a dish with oyster sauce listed on their vegetarian menu. Since when is an oyster a vegetable? The only vegetarian oyster is an oyster mushroom!  I understand that there is always a risk for cross contamination and I expect it when I dine out. But this occurance is far more than just cross contamination. I mean, this thing was a pretty decent sized chunk of bird. It makes me feel uneasy about the level of cross contamination that takes place in Swadee's kitchen.   The staff was kind enough to comp the tainted Pad Thai (which accounts for the ** instead of *) but I don't believe you'll see me walking into Swadee any time in the foreseeable future.

5TgdCzIi_Xe-CpjuKt7-6Q.text: this place gets packed during lunch time  hours. the food is great and friendly customer service. I ordered a 3 and to me it seemed like it was a 4 or 5, it was hot but i love spicy food. the server had to keep bring me water to cool me down a notch, my forehead created a puddle on sweat on the floor it was that spicy but sooo good!   you sure can find me back there again.   they do have lunch specials so take advantage of it!!!

lp3ZfpGNBaGHioUMZ9JPNw.text: I was craving Thai like no other today (go figure) after passing Tipps 88 in Tempe while running errands. Seeing that it's closed on Sundays (thanks Gabi!) I convinced a friend (okay it didn't take any convincing at all) to head to Swaddee in our continuing search for best Thai food in Phoenix.  Swaddee is hidden away in the corner of a plaza, but the inside decor does not disappoint. It's not too large and not too small. Rather, it's just the right size. The tables were simple. We had a one with a black cloth, an image centered in the middle, and a glass overlay but I was completely drawn to it.   We started our meal with the small portion of Tom Ka with chicken and it was amazing. Some of the best I've had. It had the right amount of spices and flavor as well as the right amount of heat. My main course was the pineapple curry (medium), which was just as incredible. It was a little hotter than medium, which was perfect and full of flavor. The shrimp were huge and delicious and the pineapple was fresh. For dessert, my friend ordered the coconut ice cream and I ordered the golden banana (banana and coconut in a spring roll). We ended up each taking half the banana and opening it like a spring roll and putting ice cream on top. Hands down this is one of the best desserts I've ever had. Even if you dine alone at Swaddee, you *have* to order both. I'm not going to lie. I might come back here just for dessert.   I'm glad to have finally found another Thai restaurant other than Malee's I can call home!

VpUkQNKLcJ7zU3uFSqQ19w.text: I like this place. Parking is easy in back. Service is good. Price is reasonable. I like to get the Pad Thai level 5 hot. I also like the Fried Rice with Pork. I suggest you go  with level 5 heat and lots of water.

wFXNuMeTN2K0QOQpuafIFA.text: Pierre, with comments like that i have no choice LOL   Swaddee is OK. See, there i did not say it sux or not worth it. You happy now? LOL ;)  Yeah, its alright. Been there bunch of times for lunch from work and once for dinner. Dinner was better. Lunch is fine. Do not believe their star rating, 5 will NOT burn your eyes out.   Now, is it best Thai ever? Noup, it aint. Is it best in the neighborhood? MAYBE! However is you are willing to go a few miles West into Foothills you will find Thai Basil which i think quite a bit better.   Now, there we have it. Efff me and my effing opinions :)  "Its awight"  Eugene

1YIL8tjKjWlATs8K7CKwUQ.text: Monty and I went again for lunch, really good, he had curry again because he just cant help himself - yellow this time, and he said it was super duper good... but hot - not TOO hot though.  I had the pad thai - frickin good!  Different than I have had before, but really good, spicy (3), perfect balance of everything.  YUM!

P9oGIkFN4ejkro86XricjQ.text: This has to be the best Thai food around. I have tried a few other places, but none are as authentic and delicious as Swaddee. We are now regulars and have never been disappointed.

ip6YMuSGdAqu3SjrQ2LhWA.text: Currently my fave Thai, and I regularly go to the one in Flagstaff after a day of snowboarding (ok that isn't sooo often).  At lunch I go for the pad thai w/ soft tofu, #2 spicy, egg ok.  My vegetarian pals love the joint as well.  BTW, if noodles sound a bit heavy today, the Mee krob appetizer is like the pad thai w/ the egg & shrimp but with the airy crispy white noodles w/ sweet sauce to hold it together.  Dinner I go for the regular pad thai and the steamed fish.  The curries are tasty but small portions.

tXbgz_CjdF4dR5K6GLQzFA.text: Overall I enjoyed my dinner here.  I was disapointed that they didn't have veggie spring rolls in rice paper that aren't deep fried.  I realize that it is more of a Vietnamese dish but most Thai places serve it... I will stick with the ones that do.

_wCGA2klP6KKF0aYeH-hZg.text: I very much enjoy Swaddee and I can't believe that people are gicing this place 1 or 2 stars!!  We go frequently and have tried the following more than once:  Pad See Iew, Pad Woon Sen (my favorite noodle dish), Coconut Princess, Thai Fried Rice (the best), Chicken Satay, and Tom Ka soup.  All are delicious!!!  The dinner price is a little high, but I think you find that anywhere.  We've never had an issue with the servers being slow.  They do tag team and I don't think they speak a ton of excellent English, which is why they are pretty quiet.  I don't mind that, as you get to eat your food in peace!  Their food is pretty spicy, so I never go over a 2 star.  You'll clean out your sinuses at a 4 or 5 star!!    I really enjoy this place and think you ought to give it a try to decide for yourself!

kkubVYwfAwDrWA7uwfOF_w.text: This place always completes my Thai craving.  I'm not a Thai expert & I'm not going to pretend to be... I can pronounce anything on their menu.  but I absolutely love Pad Thai.  Swaddee Thai is a little pricey for me... yikes... (then again, I am a seriously broke college student & a barista so I'm sure if you're a normal professional human, you'll be just fine)... their lunch specials are awesome.  Whenever I go, it is always empty!!!  Usually not a great sign... but I think I just get cravings at weird times.  HAH.  Always order a Thai Iced Tea... because it is some sort of sugar coma inducing tradition.  Delicious.  But to the main reason I'm writing this review!!!  PAD THAI.  The shrimp are always plump... the noodles are always just right... the seasoning is exactly what I want and need out of my Pad Thai dish.  The bean sprouts are crunchy and wonderful.  I'm a wimp & I get zero to none spicy because I can't take it otherwise & it's usually still spicy?  I think they do that just to spite me.  I've had their pineapple fried rice before which I would describe as... Meeeh.  Take it or leave it.  I think I found two and a half chunks of pineapple within the rice.  They always treat you well here... keep your glasses full... I love it.

NuK6opVOcSXDQAUjZ3tOQQ.text: I've eaten a lot of Asian food in my time, having traveled abroad extensively and having lived in California, but I don't think I have come across better Thai food. The green and red curries are delectable and can be made as mild or as spicy as your palate (and non-asbestos coated tongue) can handle. 1 is mild, 2 is considered medium, and 5 is Three-Mile Island hot (don't do this if you truly like yourself or even just marginally like yourself).   If you do decide to go, the evenings are not quite as busy as lunchtime. If you choose to try Swaddee during your lunch hour, then I highly suggest that you get there as soon as it opens for lunch, because Intel is right next door and many employees opt to eat at Swaddee.   Also, if you plan on bringing kids with you to the restaurant, then be careful which tables you sit at because some have piccies of scantily-clad (some nekked) ladies. I was forced to strategically place some condiments over one of the said scantily-clad ladies in a bit of a hurry just  recently.

mHeKc-dvGm5wFaBZn5Oe_A.text: I definitely go here when I'm in the area... good flavors and quality food for a reasonable price.

TvxHIAPm08Fb_5aXqr5cIA.text: I really like Swaddee. As you may have noticed from my pics, I am not Thai. I probably don't know diddly about what "authentic" Thai food should taste like. But what I DO know is Swaddee makes great curry. Very addicting, with the perfect balance of hot and sweet.   Their lunch Special is very good and resonaly priced, too. choose one main dish out of more than a dozen choices with your choice of beef, chicken, pork, or tofu, plus salad, egg roll, steamed rice.

gLRlmmULpmgpr-jB087aqQ.text: I have been going to Swaddee Thai for a couple of years.  It is my favorite Thai restaurant.  I had lunch there this past weekend, and after not having there for a couple of months, it reminded me why I like the food so much.  The truth is that I usually stick to three of me favorite dishes every time I go.  I usually get my food pretty spicy, a 4 from a range of one to five.  The vegetarian options are excellent, as most Thai restaurants can prepare most dishes as vegetarian.  My favorite dish in the menu is yellow curry, which is a mix of vegetables in a curry sauce, with rice on the side.  I also really like their spicy noodles.  It may not sound as terribly adventurous, but it has lots of flavor.  It is also a dish that would go very well with most people who are new to Thai food. And my other favorite is Tom Yum soup, which is hot and sour.  I have taken several friend to this restaurant and they have not been disappointed.  And for those who are not sure about Thai food I always suggest that they start with the spicy noodles.  The noodles can be prepared with very little spice if requested that way.  For a long time, I have been telling myself that I would write a review for this restaurant. Done!

-nbLPay1olOP6pGW3w8fLA.text: Simply the best Thai food I've had anywhere, and I'm quite the culinary Asiaphile... I've been all over California, tried a lot of Thai dishes, and simply haven't found it's equal. The pla rhad prik (catfish in red curry) is probably the best thing I've eaten, ever. 'Nuff said.

GCflRKVdX-8gkbTrh4dBIA.text: The food is good and I have always loved going here for lunch or dinner...until the roaches crawling on the walls, the tables - EEEWW! Click on the date for any "complain inspection" and you will see they find roaches here - continually! maricopa.gov/envsvc/envw... I have stopped going here and, instead, go to Yupha's Thai which is better food and, no roaches. Note that the Via Linda location does not have any problems and, in fact gets awarded Silver or Gold awards from the Maricopa County Inspections. It is only the Chandler location that is a problem and should be avoided.

uCQTwt8b0gOhUAMkKGH27Q.text: Excellent, consistent, hot food. Never disappointed. Faves: Hot Basil chicken, Cashew Nut Chicken, Pad thai, and Tom Yum soup. Friendly staff and clean environment. We go more than once a week.

kgsFCB6M_1kCHTIhlOp96w.text: excellent atmosphere and authenticate Thai cuisine. spice level on food is always a bit skewed in Arizona i ordered Thai Fried Rice with star rating of 4 out of 5 and for me it was more like a 2. non the less flavor was right on point.

LPSefImkbSoeZqqUZM_HDg.text: This was the first and only Thai place I've been to in AZ.  Overall, it is pretty good.  I think we will probably try a new place next time but if we can't find anything better, I think we won't have any problem going back to Swaddee.  *Price = on the high-end  *Pad Thai = pretty good volume *Green Curry = very good. *Garlic delight = The portion is way too small to charge $11

NNnDoH6PIl6OU66VX_Kv1w.text: Favorite Thai restaurant in the valley and I eat alot of Thai. Their fried rice and Tom yum soup are second to none. Would go there more but it's a drive from where I live.

rv1tyx47zMec1ptBTLCl9Q.text: The food is the best Thai food ever, the weekday customer was great but at weekend customer service was horrible, unprofessional, there is one waitress at weekend, she act like hated me for no reason the first time I met her, my husband who is not very sensitive, he was like omg that girl hates you and she won't want to talk to me or even look at me even i was smiling and really nice to her everytime, she just can't be friendly to me only , Idk it's because I'm Asian, and she is asian or I looked like someone she knew?! Regardless, it was super unprofessional and uncomfortable. But the food is so good, and the place is really clean, owner were very nice.

LtmOdLXTGxxKUjNZKvHYzQ.text: Very delicious. I had the chicken pad thai, spicy level 2 which was not spicy but very very delicious & full of flavor. The staff is helpful & courteous I would definitely eat here again & recommend it to anyone. But if you're like me & like it spicy, order it level 4-5 :)

wTqrnyBytyLrRi8Oap0ScQ.text: I took a break from this restaurant for about 2 yrs because of bad service. Decided to return tonight. It was a total mistake. The waitress took us to our seat and left. Seconds later she sat a couple behind us. 10 or so minutes later she came over to us. I told her we were ready to order. We were told she will be back to get our order because she has to ask her coworker if the couple sitting in front of us has been taken care of. I thought that was rude, but let it slide. About 10 minutes later she came and took our order. Now, in between this, the couple  behind us has their water. After a few minutes more, we got our water. Then our order came, but one was wrong. After talking it through, she admitted she wrote it down wrong (she looked at her order sheet). The couple behind us got their water, their food, their utensils, and extra plates. We reminded our waitress 3x we needed our utensils so we can start eating. In between this, we don't even have any napkins. When we finally got our napkins, still no utensils. My hub went to the front and had to wait to get our utensils. When the correct food came, it was WTF moment because the food was not done correctly. So my kids ended up eating the incorrect food with no extra plates. Our water glasses were all empty. We waited for a while. My son said he was thirsty. By now I am mad. I went to ask the waitress if I can grab the water pitcher. She gave me an indecisive look and never responded. Needless to say I grabbed it and refilled our glasses myself. I will say I am 100% sure we will never returned. I will say this. The couple in front and behind us are Caucasian. If you tell me it is not a race issue, I will wholeheartedly refute that. I see the waitress bend over backwards to please these two couples while we are neglected.

GNNX2BqwPxVChJ1PtjfBgw.text: Excellent food, but horrible service. We stopped by to try this restaurant today because my friend said the food was great. I would love to give 5stars for the food because we've eaten at many Thai Food Restaurant, and this one taste better than most places. I didn't asked for the server name, but she was the short and a bit chubby girl. Bring out the food and 5min later she bring us the check without saying anything, and every time I raised my hand to ask for something, she saw me but then ignore and look away. The whole time, no greeting, no saying thanks you, nothing. We end up leaving the tips for the kitchen, instead of the servers because we received the worst service ever.

photos.caption: Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Food was tasty, but horrible service.

dK_iz9z1sk6zV3pwciNlJw.text: I've been going here for a few years but not sure due to the recent changes in service protocol. Food is generally good but the restaurant does tend to nickel and dime. It's charges 18% automatically for parties of five. I think it should be 6 especially since I have three young kids. I understand it their policy but I think they are tryin to make people automatically forced to pay more. Also, I asked for side of white rice for our party of five and they charged $8 for white rice. That is ridiculous.  Most restaurants charge $4-5 which I think is a fair price. I can buy a 10lb bag of rice for $10! Not sure I will be back.

3VrS6x1ZxgBybeWGh5YAQw.text: Major WIN from this girl ... I have never been a huge fan of thai food especially curry. But I had family in town and it was convenient.   Well slap me BECAUSE it was fantastic and I will be back.   There were four of us so we each ordered a course and it was the perfect amount!   Chicken Hot Pot (with clear noodles)  Pot Stickers  Chicken yellow curry {MY FAVE} Shrimp broccoli & noodles ... {a little sweet}   Great atmosphere ... We sat there for almost two hours enjoying our meal and chatting. There were several other larger groups all sharing too. Seems to be a trend.   I HIGHLY recommend!

Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chicken Yellow Curry
Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chicken Hot Pot

H6bEPv3W6RgX-SYDw1yUWw.text: Had been to this place awhile ago (probably previous owners or before they remodeled) and was ok with the food but it was a bit dated (and there was a bug on my table).  Years later came back with a coworker and wow have things changed! They've since redecorated and it's super clean now (no more fear of bugs).  The pad thai I had was delicious and coconut ice cream was awesome. Highly recommend this place if you're looking to get a Thai fix.

w2EvsnQWlrqeMuIEh8TsTQ.text: Do not eat here! I jus picked up take out and there is a small cock roach in my soup. I have never had this happen before.

photos.caption: Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Cockroach in my take out soup!

kIskeGl1aXQPMSy5NqaqdQ.text: Delicious!  Always on time, fresh, and consistent.  I've tried other Thai places in the area and this is by far my favorite.  Every time I am in the Phoenix area I stop in here.

5ASMBPOQILK5_qksTQXR5Q.text: I went here last week with a friend after waffling between here and Thailicious. Full disclaimer? Thailicious is better, but they have better deals here. They have dinner specials for about 9$ that comes with a salad with peanut dressing, an entree and a spring roll...not a bad deal. Also, the portion is large, I had more than enough for lunch the next day (and the flavors were better the next day too). I had the spicy noodles at a 3.5 heat level and it was spicy, but not burning my face off. My friend had the pad se ew and she thought it was ok... nothing special. At the end, we wanted to try the raved about coconut ice cream, but they brought our check without asking about dessert and promptly disappeared... so that was that. This probably wouldn't be my first choice of Thai in the area, but I would go back.   PS When I walked in, I almost had a heart attack because they had an ATM sitting there... is this place cash only?!?! Oh no!.... No, they do take cards...phew!

SVgsjsOTUb9rfQ9gxVPzsA.text: I have always enjoyed their spicy noodles dish.   However, the petit waitress could be a little more friendly.

Y1W2aZUGaH20Gh_Tfj981w.text: I've been coming here for years and the staff always recognizes me. I enjoy the food and the presentation is lovely. On 2/12, my fiance and I decided to stop in for dinner. We were given these adorable coconut desserts on the house. They were made for Valentine's Day and were delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Coconut dessert for Valentine&#39;s Day.

3V3P9ql0GMuO82Sly6J5Og.text: The BEST Pad Thai & Spicy noodles. Love getting the take out. Staff are always very friendly! This is our go to for Thai!

xFOB5HfaWHCWnh125wAKmw.text: I ordered a pick up order for the first time after hearing about their good food from some friends. The woman on the phone sounded beyond rude and still gave her the benefit of the doubt.  When I went to pick up my order she didn't even bother to say hi or anything. She talked as if she was annoyed. When I paid, she gave me both receipts with my card, slammed a pen in front of me to sign a receipt and left. I was standing there with a signed receipt, a pen upset. She was too busy sitting down at a table and talking to another server. Then a guy saw it, came to me running and said thank you and took care of it. Such an unacceptable behavior. Totally ruined my day. Food tasted good, but for some reason gave me a stomachache. Never going back to be treated so terribly.

o0M2UC6RRXBATA9wuT2s0A.text: Excellent. I love the chicken and noodles. That's all I've ever gotten, but it is amazing. I go here whenever I visit Arizona.

nHyQGr3OjJBz5OWrDsGB7g.text: We are coming to this place since we moved to Phoenix last year. It's has become our go-to place for Thai food. Food are delectable and yum. My personal favorite is Penang Curry, Green Curry and Red Curry. My wife loves Thai Iced Coffee. I will also recommend Chicken Satay.   I feel Pad Thai needs improvement.

OApcLYNkNVCBErVvMfT-AA.text: Our go to for Thai. The service can be a bit off but the food is delicious. Definitely try the Phad Thai which comes with beef, chicken, and shrimp. You get to choose your spice level - even their medium is pretty hot! Also the crab puffs and orange chicken dish are delicious.

MiJK_SE27xFXOjXwLYYQLQ.text: Swaddee, what happened?! I used to love you. I guess now that I've been exposed to really wonderful, flavorful Thai, your restaurant just isn't as appealing to me as it was 10 years ago.  My husband and I dined at the Chandler location recently since it's near his work. He got the house salad which was just a standard salad with bland peanut dressing. What upset him is that the "shrimp" listed in the description was just that-- ONE SHRIMP, singular.  I got the spicy eggplant figuring that would be a good choice since eggplant is in season. It was just ok. I tasted more grease than anything else, but I was missing all those hot/sour/sweet/bitter elements that I expect with Thai food.  Luckily there are other Thai places in the area. It's time to move on.

psD7GB2aS7LGyWhkAd8qKQ.text: Worst Thai restaurant I ever visited. Their curry dishes are awful. PLEASE DO NOT ORDER RED CURRY OR GREEN CURRY! your best options are spicy noodles and pad Thai!  I was not happy with taste. Decent ambience but not so good food!

K_fP9j57coKG6txKeg1jzA.text: This is hands down my favorite Thai restaurant in the greater Phoenix area. The ambience is nice ~ jazz music and dimly lit enough to make the small restaurant feel more intimate.  The servers are super nice and the food comes out piping hot and really quickly. The food tastes amazing and is an affordable price. I always have enough leftover to take home for another full meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Spicy Thai fried rice and chicken pad Thai

gzOwlv5NidRT6bMGQJLD0w.text: I was very disappointed by my experience here. I am not sure if they are the same Swaddee that used to be down in Scottsdale, but I've been meaning to come here since that one closed.   I ordered a glass of wine and a veggie yellow curry, heat 4. Personally I expect the heat 4 to be hot. It was medium. Especially on a curry scale.   I asked for extra potatoes in the curry. The first time, it came out with no potatoes. I asked if they perhaps didn't have potatoes. She apologized and asked if she could take it back. It came back with ~4 small potato halves in it. Not what I expected. The curry was ok, but it's extra watery and the flavors aren't absorbed by the vegetables.   The wine came out after the food. You get a 10% discount if you pay in cash, but all together this was $20 with the tip.

MKZIN2NijOvpCDqRfS1iZA.text: Swaddee was decent. I had the red curry chicken lunch special ($7.95) and tom kha gai soup ($6.95). I got the order to go and it was packaged well, all ready to go when I came in to pick it up. The lunch special includes a generous portion of curry, a mound of white rice, salad, and a tiny little egg roll. The egg roll had a ton of wrapping with a small amount of filling. The rice was very slightly crunchy tasting in some parts. The red curry was lighter and a little sweeter tasting than other versions I've had and was watery. The salad had a peanut dressing on it which tasted decent.  The tom kha gai was also a sizeable portion of soup, filled with chicken and vegetables. The soup was actually thicker than the curry, and had a strong sour flavor.   Service was friendly and polite at the counter.  I asked for both dishes 4 out of 5 in terms of spiciness but they turned out more like mild/medium say like 2-3 level to me.   Overall they have good portions and friendly service but the food is about average.

photos.caption: Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Tom kha gai and red curry chicken lunch special

Yba_UbM9YlNjLptqucvrWQ.text: Best pad Thai and Tom kha soup in town and it never disappoints. We figured out that to get the pad Thai spice level to our liking, we have to specifically ask them "spice level 4 with added fresh chilis" but be careful because it's super spicy with fresh chilis. The tom kha soup is always spicy and the perfect balance of sour, spicy, creamy. Our favorite Thai restaurant for sure and we've been to almost all

photos.caption: Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Combination appetizer platter. Meehh
Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Pad Thai level 3 with fresh chilis for added spice. Perfect saucy, sweet, sour, spicy

l5xdHSZ2O_w_ODSC66bNFA.text: Extraordinarily delicious!  Great service.  Honored a couple special requests regarding food prep.  The dish was served to my personal absolute perfection!  Strongly recommend the Thai iced coffee.

Y6LpBQwQdrIbgpXeHjjUlw.text: My review is purely on the sticky rice - since that's all I got from here.  I was visiting my in-laws and wanted to grab sticky rice for my son since I didn't have the stuff to make it myself. It's $3 for one order. The lady there told me it wasn't much rice, so I ordered two orders.  She was honest about it being a small portion, so I wasn't too upset about that. I was annoyed that one of the two tiny orders wasn't even edible. I got the bottom of the warmer/dried out sticky rice. My two year old could eat a whole order himself - their portions were that small. I had to throw out a whole order and my son ate the entire second order.  I may be a sticky rice snob but even for ppl who aren't sticky rice snobs...if you're guna charge $3/order, make it worth $3.

Y47tjF443uA4kwY-V6xgpw.text: Came here once 2 yrs ago, found this place again by luck and fell inlove with them all over again.  The duck panang is flavorful, crab puffs are awesome! This is the first for dinner here and it was well worth the wait.

uYkPzlim_nD6Xp4La_ojfw.text: This place is very close to where I live and is my go to place to get take out for Thai food. I have never been disappointed with the food or service here. The ambience is pleasant.

ICrvrp7U5G8ABgUZIzlMog.text: Walking in, I guess it was a bad sign when we only saw 1 person there.  Service was prompt but a bit gruff.  Lunch special ordered with decent sized portions but mediocre taste. La's Thai at  15050 N Northsight Blvd Scottsdale, AZ 85260  is way better.

Jv5FHG-xjJC5hOB48uPUwQ.text: Swaddee is the only restaurant that I have to go to every time when I come back to visit family. It is still my favorite Thai place that I have visited. The food tastes great, portions are large, and the value (lunch specials on weekdays) is amazing. My favorite dish from them is the pad Thai, which is perfectly cooked. I would also recommend the yellow curry, pad see ew, and spicy noodles. The pineapple fried rice is also wonderful. I have also had other dishes, but these are the ones that I love most. Service and the environment are perfect for nice occasions or just casual eating.   Over the years, the spicy scale of 1-5 is not very consistent unless you are on the 1 side.

Ol_StExlOI_XivB8LXCmbA.text: Pickup is the way to go and pay with cash for the 10% discount. To feed 8 folks for takeout it was ~$116 with plenty for left overs. The items we ordered and all enjoyed were:  -Tom Kha soup (light sour curry with veggies) -Spicy eggplant (served with ground beef and jalapenos, spicy got a level 2) -2 orders of pad thai with chicken -Pad see ew (thicker noodles with egg, level 2 with pork) -Cashew chicken (very saucy, just needed a little more cashews) -2 orders of crab puffs served with sweet and sour  There are a lot of Thai places in Chandler but this is a good spot for lunch and takeout.

Hq8ZFBRwsNQ7fbKME8u07A.text: Best Thai in the neighborhood for sure.  Always prompt service & food comes out quickly, great for work lunches.  I order take-out from here on the reg as well & it's always ready on time & exactly what I asked for, down to the seventeen different requests from my picky peeps...

Cv5BUYgfTo8yfh0gLQEKWw.text: Waited almost 20 min before we waved someone down to take our order. "Yea, I'm busy" was her response. Fried rice was soggy. BBQ chicken was bland. Only dish I enjoyed was their Tom yom soup. I had to go to the counter to get our to go box and check. We won't be coming back.

MDlVz6py_a21Ox-40wbTPg.text: Awful!!! Anyone that claims this is good Thai has never ate outside of Phoenix.  The place is awful.  I ordered take out of yellow curry with potatoes and chicken with fried rice which by the way was 25 bucks for one person.  25 bucks at a grocery store for one person can go a far way.  Next, it came in a container which 95% was the yellow curry liquid.  I came with 3 pieces of chicken and one potato.  This is full truth..  I even dumped the liquid out and even pieced the potato together and three pieces of chicken.  The rest was green pepper.  So bad.  Experience: Have had Thai all over the USA AND Thailand.  Yup, I got ripped off and obviously these people don't mind getting ripped of with the high reviews.   100% Truth to this review.  You've been warned.

YKIIbEsI_eT565uqTkUW2Q.text: Went for Sunday at lunch,  1. Can't understand the servers and they can't understand you so they get your order incorrect. 2. A little pricey for the quality of food in my opinion. You get a lot of food, but not the best tasting Thai Cuisine.  3. It messes with your stomach   Wouldn't recommend, would go to Panda Express any day over here

nHyzWzuaRCNQLach40I7vQ.text: The best Thai place ever.our family always go over there whenever we crave for some Thai food.never got disappointed.spicy fried rice,tom yum soup, eggplant beef and spicy basil or ginger chicken is something you can try and won't regret.

4-0DxZB0zGU4IZMBsRoTcw.text: We went by Swaddee for dinner on a Friday night and there were only a couple of people there ... Really surprised it wasn't busy based on the reviews. I think I'd give this restaurant more of a 2.5 but I rounded up.  Obviously we were seated right away, and soon after, we placed our order and the food came out in a reasonable amount of time. We got the Swaddee Fried Rice (medium spice) and the Cashew Nuts Delight (medium hot spice). The Cashew Nuts Delight definitely had a kick to it and was really tasty. I thought that there were a lot of cashews in there but too many vegetables compared to chicken. The Swaddee Fried Rice was almost too sweet with the pineapple (which it doesn't say it has in it on the menu, I think?), raisins, and Chinese Sausage. We had gotten a glass of the Thai Tea as well; it was $2.50 and came in a much smaller glass than it does at other restaurants.  I thought that the prices were a bit higher for the entrees than other places, but the portion sizes were maybe larger than at other places. Not sure when/if we will be back. With so many other Thai restaurants to pick from, we'll venture to try something different in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Cashew Nuts Delight with Chicken.
Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Swaddee Fried Rice.

trH9zjYsVXyVcXPTTBQ2sw.text: The food was terrible. The sweet and sour chicken had no chicken. It was basically breading with a vegetables sweet and sour sauce. The beef PAd Seu had very little flavor and beef was a poor quality. This was our first and last time for this restaurant. Also water drinking water tasted bad.

rVDX3i0C5u1vT9LdABOvtA.text: Love this place. Food is consistently good. I've been coming here for years and have never had a bad experience. The staff are always nice.

JXFsBow5q_8ojDS1NBwZ5w.text: Loved this restaurant, the food was fabulous! We had a flavorful chicken lime and cilantro salad to start. I had spicy noodles with chicken and my friend had yellow curry. Both were done to perfection. We talked to people as as they were leaving. They are repeat customers and said they absolutely love the food! The prices and presentation was very nice as well.

o2zpkFY-A2-kl-ynme7CZA.text: Good place but hours are not accurate.  There is 2 hour break on Saturday- closed between 3-5 pm.

WjWZaOcQg9TojbO0s987SA.text: Great Thai food! Our first time here... Almost everything we ate was very good. We ordered chicken satay, grilled beef salad, tiger cry (beef dish), grilled pork, and Thai shrimp fried rice. I love the dry chili dipping sauce that came with the dishes! We ordered a level 3 spice, and it wasn't spicy for us. The chicken satay was dry and I wouldn't order that again. We also got the Thai iced tea and Thai iced green tea. They were both good, but a little on the sweeter side. I am looking forward to trying other dishes on their menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Grilled pork
Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Tiger cry (beef)
Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Chicken Satay

3ctY3AVMp_NrrWfcXTiUjw.text: Swaddee Thai has the best Thai food I have tasted in Arizona. The flavors are on point, the rice cooked well (not too soft/mushy, not dry).   My friend had been going here for years and introduced me to this place last year when I first moved to Arizona.   Service:  The staff is very welcoming and the restaurant has great customer service. The servers are always smiling, are patient, frequently fill your water glasses, and ask if you need anything throughout your meal.   Ambiance:  The ambiance at this restaurant is romantic with Thai silk paintings and decor on all the walls. There's a large fish tank in the middle of the room as well.   Food:  *Papaya Salad* - WARNING! This dish is already pretty spicy, so I would recommend a Spicy Level of 1 or 2 for this appetizer if you can handle spicy food, but don't want your tongue or throat to burn. Definitely ask for the least amount of spice for this one. It's one of my favorites. Healthy and refreshing, it's the perfect appetizer to a heavy Thai meal to follow.   --All the curries are so delicious! Generous portions, not too watery, and the meat is cooked so well.  *Red Curry Chicken* My all-time favorite. You can taste the coconut milk more in this, the green, and the yellow curries more than the panang curry.  *Panang Curry Chicken* Has more Indian flavors, the sliced onion  *Massaman Curry* add more peanuts to your liking!  *Pad Thai* I always order pad thai with a side of fried tofu and share it with a friend. The portions are huge, so ordering 2-3 items and sharing them is smart. The noodles are cooked well, not too thick or thin, just right, and soaked in a delicious peanut sauce. My friends and I always ask for more peanuts on the side as well. The Pad Thai doesn't get as spicy as the papaya salad, so I recommend a 4-5 spicy level if you like it spicy!

photos.caption: Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Panang with chicken
Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Penang curry with chicken and white rice

ucIlJoEql1Grj8OfNCfPKg.text: Went back and again, it was delicious and I over ate. What's new right? I think this is going to become my regular Thai place now.

NH8kCdbOG5HH268WWVdg8Q.text: If you want authentic Thai food, come here! It's very delicious. Staff is super friendly. Inside gives you the feel of the Thai culture. Love the new open space concept inside as well! Definitely family friendly! We had the Panang, fried rice, sweet and sour chicken. Absolutely superb! Excellent service.

pzVG-ljtZTiAtdxMHJKgfQ.text: It was pleasantly surprised. We didnt expect to be very good to be honest. The location was kind of hidden and had some trouble finding. The restaurant was clean and they were able to make us a table for 12people. The pineapple fried rice, pad thai, and the egg plant were all really good. Pad thai had its authentic kick to it. I really enjoyed the food here. I will be back for sure.

qgqurEtFGubDsAhytxKfgw.text: Can't believe I've been living in Chandler for a year and didn't know about this place. Swaddee Thai Cuisine is INCREDIBLE. The restaurant is beautifully decorated and pleasant to sit in. I went with my dad, who had a lot of requests and questions about his food, but the staff was still really nice to him. (Side note: my dad is vegan, and they told him that everything on the menu can be made vegan). My dad ordered the Pad See Ew and I had the Red Curry. We both thoroughly enjoyed our meals. I'd highly recommend this restaurant!

WSmcOHNH_9XVg0_4BQ5d0w.text: Great little place tucked away in strip mall.  Good service, and smiling staff.  Low lighting and nice ambience.  My yellow coconut curry chicken was simply divine.  Been wanting to try this cute place for a while and so glad I did!   Will be back to try something else for sure!  Tasted even better the next day because the portion was large enough for two sittings! Thank you...lovely experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Yellow chicken curry and white rice

i9L6PxNKW4eaGKi6dF3CTA.text: The food was delicious, the environment is very pleasant and the Ambiance is appealing. Also the service was excellent.

nME-i5y2EYVjYVFC3aLA5A.text: Fast service and really great quality Thai food, this restaurant is perfect for the office worker that need a new lunch spot. I've been coming here since I was a little kid. I remember during summer break my mom would pick me up for lunch and we would go to Swaddee for their lunch specials haha. The Shrimp Curry is my go to and I like my food spicy so I usually do 4/5 stars and then brown rice instead of white rice. I have tried almost all of the lunch specials and they are all delicious especially their red curries and noodle dishes! You always get a small salad with peanut sauce and a spring roll with your lunch special and if you have room for dessert you NEED to try their Coconut Ice Cream. It is out of this world with salty crunchy peanuts on top, I could eat it forever! I will definitely be back to this establishment very soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Pad Woon Sen with Tofu
Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. Spicy Shrimp With Curry (lunch special)

0xIulJZijphZgmubYgtK_w.text: Decent food,, great curry and Tom Yum soup.. however the service is just okay.. the male server is not very friendly and kind of slow sometimes.. wish the service was better and keep the food still tasty. I still recommend this place

jk9oaIVFyt1Z0hHQobeLOg.text: It all started back in June 2016 when my wife and I had just conquered Humphreys up in Flag and needed a good place to get our grub on. We came across Swaddee Thai up there and loved the food so much we knew we had to check out the other location which was coincidentally right in our backyard. Fast forward and when it came to my wife's birthday, she requested Thai so we knew exactly where to go! The food was just as delicious as the location up north. The Pad Thai was just the right amount of spicy. The Tom Kah soup was downright heavenly (I could've gone for another bowl myself!). The service was fantastic and really homey--made you feel like you were in a Thai family's home kitchen! Needless to say, birthday dinner was a great success.  Oh and I can't forget about that Thai iced tea! But I definitely recommend ordering it to be served with your main dishes, as it will be waaay too tempting to drink it all before your food arrives if they serve it first.

xeXfQO9G_jCXaTObs8HgXA.text: if I could rate this business negative, I would. how could they got 5stars in previous reviews? we ordered the bbq chicken and 3 more entrees. the other 3 were decent, only the bbq chicken suck to death and not good to eat any more, we felt like it was kept in the fridge for more than a year or something, we ended up not eating the chicken since we dont want to get sick. we let them know cuz I dont want they keep selling the old chicken to anyone else. however, we still willing to pay for all 4 dishes since we ordered. AND, what the....no apology but they gave us attitude before we left the restaurant, what kind of business is this???? If we ever get sick by one bite on that chicken by tomorrow, they will be in trouble....!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Swaddee Thai Cuisine - Chandler, AZ, United States. thai bbq chicken, stay away!!!!!

hSx1sNsX4YrWSu4zClO7QQ.text: The spicy noodles with chicken were amazing!!! I got a level 1 spice. Though it still had some kick, I think I will try a level 2 next time. Great flavor and a great deal for the lunch special. The vegetable roll was delicious as well. Not a fan of the dressing on the salad, but overall I can see myself becoming a regular! Can't wait to go back!

XtX5O3iE3cGJwHe_mtRyXg.text: I eat here just about every week and it doesn't get old. Best Thai in the Tempe chandler area. Pad see ew is what I get and the crab puffs are BEYOND amazing, with their sauce.

zcjJ0Q8nzDF-bTt92xfPjQ.text: Found this hidden gem, of course on Yelp!   Authentic Thai food with lots of Thai tradition decorations  around this restaurant.  We felt a bit overwhelmed from all the different items on the menu!  The descriptions made everything sound so good.  It was 4 girls total and we shared everything. We ordered the Tom Kha hot pot #25, Pad See Ew Chicken #65, Thai BBQ chicken #31, and Papaya Salad #14.  It was all very appetizing. Everything had the right amount of spice. We were very satisfied. The spice is out of a 5 and majority of the dishes were 3-4. Next time I'll try the 5 to see how spicy it is.  The service was a 3 out of 5 stars. He took our order and went about his way. Refilled our water frequently.   I'm glad I found another Thai restaurant to put on my go to's!
